forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers after 4pm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 77. South wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers before 8pm, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms between 8pm and 2am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 59. Southwest wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
This afternoon, the sky hangs heavy above Boston, cloaked in a blanket of gray that hints at the fleeting rains yet to come. The temperature hovers around a mild 77 degrees, with a gentle south wind caressing the city at 10 mph, weaving soft whispers of possibility into the air. However, the ardent sun remains cloistered, as if waiting for a moment to break free, with only the faintest chance of rain showers nudging at the edges of the day. The world may feel somewhat muted, but that lends itself to the allure of quiet contemplation—perhaps a stroll down the Esplanade, where the scenery wraps itself in mystery.

As night approaches, the likelihood of showers and possibly a thunderstorm lingers, casting an air of anticipation over the evening. The temperature will dip to a comfortable low of around 59 degrees, inviting light layers to safeguard against the slight chill that accompanies a whisper of rain. A late-night walk could still be in order, draped in a cardigan, as you listen to the city gently hum—the distant sounds of revelry melding with the soft patter of raindrops. Such moments, while beguilingly simple, hold a beauty all their own, inviting one to savor the richness of a Boston evening, even as clouds gather and dusk settles in.
